titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of his papers at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: University Archives

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: American industrial designer. Collection includes notes, drawings, correspondence, reports, conference materials, public relations and marketing material, product data, slides, transparencies, models, and much more.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: George A. Beck (1908-1977) was an American industrial designer. He first worked for Montgomery Ward and then Sears Roebuck, but the majority of his career (more than thirty years, starting in 1934) was spent with General Electric

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p:
The
George Beck Papers includes notes, drawings, correspondence, reports, conference materials, public relations and marketing material, product data, slides, transparencies, models, and much more.

The collection has received minimal processing. The inventory that follows is a simple box list, and folders retain Beck's original labels and are in no particular order. Researchers are advised to read the entire inventory to ensure locating all relevant materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection has received minimal processing and remains in original order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has the papers of many noted industrial designers. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

did.unittitle: 'Fortune' article; nation & its industry in space 'industrial design'
MDA; Un. Hill renovation & cube minibus
Appliance and merchandising department, appearance design

Monroe building, Costello, Cooney and Fearon

did.abstract: including modern water colors by G. Beck
